body: use display: flex on the parent and then add justify-content: center; align-items: center; that will center the div both horizontally and vertically.
use let when the value will change, const when the value stays the same, and avoid var unless you are maintaining old code. let and const are block-scoped.
you can use list.reverse(). it reverses the list in place so you donâ€™t need slicing.
check if your anchor tag is inside another element with pointer-events: none in css. that can break your link.
a stack overflow happens when a program keeps calling functions without stopping until it runs out of memory. usually caused by infinite recursion.
